refnamediv.refpurpose: Downloads a file from the FTP server and saves to an open file

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_fget retrieves remote_file from the FTP server, and writes it to the given file pointer, handle. The transfer mode specified must be either FTP_ASCII or FTP_BINARY.

example.title: ftp_fget example
example.programlisting:
<?php

// open some file for reading
$file = 'somefile.txt';
$fp = fopen($file, 'w');

// set up basic connection
$conn_id = ftp_connect($ftp_server);

// login with username and password
$login_result = ftp_login($conn_id, $ftp_user_name, $ftp_user_pass);

// try to download $file
if (ftp_fget($conn_id, $fp, $file, FTP_ASCII, 1)) {
 echo "successfully written to $file\n";
} else {
 echo "There was a problem with $file\n";
}

// close the connection and the file handler
ftp_close($conn_id);
fclose($fp);
?>

note.para: The resumepos parameter was added in PHP 4.3.0.

refsect1.para: See also ftp_get, ftp_nb_get and ftp_nb_fget.
